definition: abbr. for 四個現代化|四个现代化[si4 ge4 xian4 dai4 hua4], Deng Xiaoping's four modernizations
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: He determined on devoting all his energies to the cause to the four modernization's construction.
sentences.chinese: 他決心把全部精力投入到四化建設事業中去。

sentences.english: It is catalyst for the Four Modernizations.
sentences.chinese: 思想政治工作是四化的催化劑。

sentences.english: For the construction of hunan"four modernizations two type" social significance.
sentences.chinese: 對於湖南建設“四化兩型”社會的重要意義。

sentences.english: This year we've made a big stride forward on the road of four modernizations.
sentences.chinese: 今年我們在四化道路上大大地邁進了一步。

sentences.english: Small rural industries are a main force for socialist construction in our nation.
sentences.chinese: 鄉鎮企業是我國四化建設中的一支重要力量。

sentences.english: It is the momentum for developing our motherland and fulfilling the four modernizations.
sentences.chinese: “這是建設祖國和實現四化的力量之源”又該怎譯？

sentences.english: We must do our bit for the four modernizations.
sentences.chinese: 我們要爲四化盡一份力量。

sentences.english: To realize the four modernization need our joint efforts.
sentences.chinese: 要實現祖國的“四化”需要我們大家的共同努力。

sentences.english: Learn English for the four modernizations, one of the three-grasping grammar.
sentences.chinese: 學英語爲四化，三基之一抓語法。

sentences.english: The time will surely come when the Chinese people will realize the four modernizations.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民實現四化的時間定要到來。

sentences.english: We are sure (that )the four modernization will be realized in China .
sentences.chinese: 我們相信四化一定會在中國實現。

sentences.english: Sometimes he seemed to break them apart.
sentences.chinese: 有時候他四化分裂開他們。

sentences.english: Everybody is aware of the importance of the Four Modernizations.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都察覺到了四化的重要性。

definition: the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1] and twelve earthly branches 十二枝/sexagenary cycle
same as 天干/the 10 heavenly stems 甲, 乙, 丙, 丁, 戊, 己, 庚, 辛, 壬, 癸 (used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal number like Roman I, II, III)
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
the 10 heavenly stems 甲[jia3], 乙[yi3], 丙[bing3], 丁[ding1], 戊[wu4], 己[ji3], 庚[geng1], 辛[xin1], 壬[ren2], 癸[gui3], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
Jinshui District of Zhengzhou City 鄭州市|郑州市[Zheng4 zhou1 Shi4], Henan
forty-eighth year H12 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1971 or 2031/cf 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], Xinhai Revolution of 1911
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
